contextId.information: The words "he himself" and "she herself" are used for emphasis to bring attention to Abraham and Sarah and to blame them for what happened. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_rpronouns]])
contextId.quote: Did he not himself say ... Even she herself

contextId.information: Here "himself" emphasizes that it is God who will provide the lamb. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_rpronouns]])
Here "himself" emphasizes that Jacob went alone in front of the others. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_rpronouns]])
contextId.quote: He himself went on ahead of them
